contextId.information: The power Nebuchadnezzar has through his army is described as the part of his body ("hand") he uses to direct his army. AT: "allowed Nebuchadnezzar's army to defeat the armies of Judah and Jerusalem and take the people into captivity." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: exiled Judah and Jerusalem by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar

contextId.information: The reference to the "uncircumcised" here is an insult, indicating that these people are foreign and have no relationship with God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

contextId.quote: whose faces were as fierce as the faces of lions

contextId.information: AT: "deeply disrespected him in her thinking" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
David is referred to by the part of the body associated with emotions. AT: "do what you would like to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: do what is in your heart

contextId.information: Yahweh tells the destroying angel to stop killing the people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
David's understanding is described as his sight. AT: "what seems good to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: what is good in your sight

contextId.information: AT: "The events in other nations that affected Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
